item.title: Hardware Wallet Design Best Practices
item.description: {% if page.transcript_by %} Transcript by: {{ page.transcript_by }}{% endif %} Hardware wallet design: issues and best practices Stepan Snigirev https://twitter.com/kanzure/status/1171322716303036417 Introduction We have 30 minutes. There’s a chance you will end up using a hardware wallet. In principle, it’s not any different from other software development.

item.title: Libbitcoin
item.description: {% if page.transcript_by %} Transcript by: {{ page.transcript_by }}{% endif %} Libbitcoin: A practical introduction or: libbitcoin’s bx tool: Constructing a raw transaction James Chiang https://twitter.com/kanzure/status/1171352496247365633 https://github.com/libbitcoin/libbitcoin-explorer/wiki/Download-BX Introduction I am going to talk about libbitcoin. It’s an alternative implementation of Bitcoin Core. There’s a few alternatives out there, like btcd and then bcoin. Libbitcoin is written in C++ and it’s the oldest alternative implementation that is out there. I’d like to show a few examples of what you can do with libbitcoin.

item.title: Lightning Network Layer By Layer
item.description: {% if page.transcript_by %} Transcript by: {{ page.transcript_by }}{% endif %} Name: Carla Kirk-Cohen Topic: The Lightning Network Layer by Layer Location: Dev++ O3-19 Tel Aviv Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tie0Gpq2eJI Transcript by: Caralie Chrisco Introduction Good afternoon everyone. My name is Carla. I’m one of the Chaincode residents from the summer residency that they ran in New York this year and this afternoon I’m going to be talking about Lightning. In this talk, I’m gonna be walking you through the protocol layer by layer and having a look at the different components that make up the Lightning Network.

item.title: Lightning Network Routing
item.description: {% if page.transcript_by %} Transcript by: {{ page.transcript_by }}{% endif %} Lightning network routing: Operation, issues and expansions Carla Kirk-Cohen Introduction Good afternoon everyone. My name is Carla. I am one of the chaincode residents this summer. This talk is going to walk through the protocol layer by layer and look at the different components that make up the network. Lightning is an off-chain scaling solution which consists of a p2p network of payment channels.

item.title: Lightning Network Sphinx And Onion Routing
item.description: {% if page.transcript_by %} Transcript by: {{ page.transcript_by }}{% endif %} Lightning network: Sphinx and onion routing Antoine Riard Introduction Hi everyone. I am a developer of rust-lightning, it started in 2018 by BlueMatt. I started contributing about a year ago now. It’s a full featured, flexible, spec-compliant lightning library. It targets exchanges, wallet vendors, hardware, meshnet devices, and you can join us on Freenode IRC in the #rust-bitcoin channel which is a really nice one.

item.title: Lightning Network Topology
item.description: {% if page.transcript_by %} Transcript by: {{ page.transcript_by }}{% endif %} Lightning network topology, its creation and maintenance Carla Kirk-Cohen Introduction Alright. Give me a second to test this. Alright. Antoine has taken you through the routing layer. I’m going to take you through what the lightning network looks like today. This is the current topology of the network and how this came about, and some approaches for maintaining hte network and making the graph look like we want it to look.

item.title: Rebroadcasting
item.description: {% if page.transcript_by %} Transcript by: {{ page.transcript_by }}{% endif %} Rebroadcasting Amiti Uttarwar (amizi) https://twitter.com/kanzure/status/1171042478088232960 Introduction Hi, my name is Amiti. Thank you for having me here today. I wanted to talk with you about rebroadcasting logic in Bitcoin Core. For some context, I’ve been working on improving it this summer. I wanted to tell you all about it. What is rebroadcasting? We all know what a broadcast is. It’s hwen we send an INV message out to our peers and we let them know about a new transaction.
